intro: Hieracium schipczinskii, commonly known as Schipczynski's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
